abstract: The drug maker increased its bid to $33 billion as it sought to fend off an unsolicited takeover offer from the Israeli pharmaceutical company Teva.
snippet: The drug maker increased its bid to $33 billion as it sought to fend off an unsolicited takeover offer from the Israeli pharmaceutical company Teva.
lead_paragraph: The drug maker Mylan on Friday raised its unsolicited offer for Perrigo, the Irish maker of store brand drugs, as it seeks to fend off its own unwanted suitor in Teva, the Israeli pharmaceutical company. But Perrigo quickly rejected the revised bid.

headline.main: Mylan Raises Its Offer for Perrigo, Which Rejects It
